comment:
Show up on time to class, put in the work. He does not hand out free points, but he is passionate about the subject and will engage you if you have questions.

Only suggestion is that I hope he invests more in his students future careers, env science is a hard profession to get into. Any help counts.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!! Awful. Tough grader takes 6 points off overall grade for every absence. Also counts 15 minutes late as an absence. Quizzes for attendance in every class. Does not give extra credit!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: He does not care about his students and how they do in his class at all. Does not offer any extra credit opportunities, test reviews are useless, claims he gives partial credit but barely does and only wants his opinion of the right answer, constantly talks down to his students and creates a very tense and unwelcome environment.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Ferr. is a clear example that KSU does not care for their students, instead they are only focused on $. He is rude, doesn't accept any answer besides his own, his test reviews are useless, and he's the worst. Don't take him if you can prevent but I know some science majors are mandated to take him. Don't expect to pass without $trocking his ego.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
Dr.Ferreira is a real expert, he knows what he's talking about and he cares about his subject. 
However, if you are someone who can't/doesn't make it to every single class it's gonna be ROUGH for you. It's 2 POINTS OFF for every class you miss after your first two. so even if you ace every test and the final paper you could fail the whole class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Daily attendance quizzes for a grade. Be able to explain the material and not just memorize for exams. Labs are slightly long and difficult but doable. Get lab manual but not tb. He did a "flipped classroom" where you have to watch lectures before class, but discussions in class end up being really interesting. He will get you to care abt envs.

Daniel has a passion for Environmental Science and Soil Science, but this is unfortunately affected by his ego. His grading is subjective at best of times (look out for this on his written response questions). Tests are often riddled with errors and information that wasn't provided. Daily pop quizzes at the beginning of class.

I dont know why his ratings are so low, I loved Dr. Ferreira! You can tell hes very passionate so that already makes the class 10x better. Hes very personable and class and labs are interesting. Attendance is mandatory and theres a quiz almost every day that counts as attendance, but theyre super easy! Exams are  not bad as long as you study!

I'm noticing he likes to answer his ratings ahahaha guess he has time. Be prepared to do a lot of attendance quizzes. 4 tests and final along with a final project. Sticks to the syllabus and is straightforward.

Lectures were straightforward and tests were based heavily off the study guide/review questions. Tries to be funny, succeeds sometimes, overall a decent professor who allowed for plenty of discussion in class. One annoying thing is that his PowerPoints were terribly dated (10 yrs old) with outdated statistics. One term paper on topic of our choice.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: He's nice, tries to be funny but is cringe most of the time. Grades like you're in your masters program instead of new to the concepts. A bit narcissistic, wrote his curriculum so it's his way/opinion or the highway, and he wont budge to help you. "Those who can, do; those who can't, teach" comes to mind. Unfortunately, he's the only ENVS professor

He said his final wasn't cumulative, and while the majority of it was focused on the last few chapters there were a few questions that were from the first units. He takes too long to grade, and he's condescending. I'm a senior making a B in an intro class, I make A's in all my senior classes, if that tells you anything. Just avoid him.

He's very funny in his lectures, and they're straightforward. The tests are based off his lectures, but the way he weights the assignments will screw you over. He also takes a long time to get discussion post grades back to you which is detrimental to you being able to improve. If you're good at memorizing minute details, take him, otherwise don't.

I wish every professor at KSU was as wonderful as Dr. Ferreira. He is passionate about Environmental Scienceas we all should be since we chose this field. He is helpful and quick to respond to emails. He makes somewhat challenging topics seem less daunting. Honestly, if youre not ready to work/study in a course, you should not go into science...

His tests weigh WAY too much. SEVENTY percent, to be exact. On top of that, he gives no partial credit on free-response test questions. I was robbed of good test scores because of that. Shame; I did good on everything else, but the above issues were enough for me to fail.

Mr. Ferreira is an extremely tough grader. The discussions have specific criteria that he holds to a super high standard and is not very understanding. The test are random buzzer questions that he thinks should be simple but aren't. Not hard material just a professor who acts like he doesn't remember what its like to be in college and offers little
Please take him, just need to attend the the classes and listen to his lectures from that answers are derived. More so. Read the PowerPoints I guarantee you will pass the class. Good luck!!!
Hands-down the most difficult class I have ever taken. No partial credit and I went to a tutor which didnt help. Avoid at all costs!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Ferreira is an awesome professor. All you have to do is what he asks of you and you will pass with flying colors. It's easy to tell that he is passionate about the subject. He's also very approachable and relatable.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Ferreira is a really great professor. He's very knowledgeable and really passionate about the material he is teaching. I'd recommend him but make sure you have the time to spend studying and completing the lab notebook otherwise you won't do well in the class.

Gives simple test that are based off of the lectures but his reports and research paper are graded very hard. My test average was a 90 and the only reason I didn't get an A in the class is because he always nitpicked every report and essay of mine.

Just another KSU PowerPoint reader. (FYI: P'point tiles can be misleading.) He is very helpful after class & during office hours. Textbook costs $200. with NO BUYBACK FROM KSU! DON'T BUY IT! Study your class notes & P'points  & you'll do fine. 2nd FYI: During class & labs, he uses coarse  "Boston Tough Guy"-type  language, and doesn't realize it...
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I did really well in his class because I took notes and studies but professors like this one is the kind that makes you feel very UN-passionate for the subject when you went in very passionate about. To me, the way he treats his students is unprofessional and just wrong at times. Throwing chalk at students it's just  abusive and out of line.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: He is such an amazing teacher. He makes chemistry so easy to understand and pass. He gives a 2-question quiz at the beginning of every class base on previous lecture. You'll definitely get the questions right even if you were half-asleep. (but be ON-TIME for the quiz!!!)) I wish he taught every class.

Quizzes given EVERY class; have to be there within 15mins to get credit for attendance; class is middle school level; tests are written to trick you; good amount memorization; labs are COMPLETELY POINTLESS. The Professor acts like his class is super important even though it is only an intro level class. No homework. Don't buy the textbook.

Dr. Ferreira is a great professor - he's energetic & gives lots of real world examples to help you apply the concepts. Highlights most of the test questions in his POWERPOINTS (as well as essay q's). Labs aren't hard but can be lengthy - each requires 1 page reflection. 3 tests & cumulative final, 4-6 pg term paper. Do the work and you'll be fine.

Doctor Ferreira is a smart professor. He loves what he teaches and is very good at it.  Test are just like the notes so if you have memorization skills it would help. I do have to warn you his grading is somewhat strict. Labs require a lot of writing each week, a one-page paper. Plus a research paper that is 4-6 pages long.

Dr. Dan has to be one of the best science professors on campus. I was not a fan of chemistry but he made it so interesting and best of all, he is clear on what he teaches. The book is not necessary because he uses powerpoints so study those notes! His test are a bit of a challenge but if you study, you will do just fine in that course.

He's pretty chillrelaxed but I don't really like his teaching style. He goes pretty fast through problems so make sure you write everything down. You might need to go to youtube to learn a concept that you might not have understood in class. Gives a two question quiz (pretty easy) on the previous class's lecture and this also counts for attendance

Each time you skip a class after 3, 1.4% off. I ended up missing total of 8 days. Easy A if you attend the class and just review the powerpoints before each test. Every single thing comes from there. What screwed me up was missing so many days but I got really good grades in tests. Needed to make high A in final to end up with 70% whi I ended with.
Takes off points for absences, and doesn't give partial credit for short answers on tests.

Dr. Ferreira is one of my fav professors. I've never met anyone let alone a teacher that responds back to my emails so fast. He truly cares about his students and will help anyone who asks for it. If you take this class seriously you can definitely make an A. He gives you everything you need to Ace the tests just do the work.

Dr. Ferreira was a great chem teacher. He does a great job teaching and keeping the class interested. Gives an easy pop quiz at the beginning of each class from previous lecture. Tests are pretty straightforward and come straight from his powerpoints that he posts on D2L from lectures. Would definitely take him again

I had a horrible experience with this professor.  Not only was he not of any assistance with anything at all but I remember two girls messing up one time and he went over there and ridiculed them in front of the entire class.  I had never taken chemistry either so a bit of guidance on how to properly use the equipment would have been nice as well.

Gives a simple 2-question quiz to mark attendance Uses a powerpoint as lecture aid and posts them online Clearly explains each point and problem Answers student questions Provides test review slideshows Semi-Easy Tests (learn the processes and you'll be fine)

Overall he is a great guy so it follows that his methods of teaching reflect that as well. He takes time to explain things in detail at least twice and isn't hesitant to answer any and all questions both in and out of class. The only thing is he takes attendance by giving short quizzes every lecture so ATTEND class and BE ON TIME!

The best professor I've had in my career as a student so far. Clear, explicit, concise,and down to Earth. Tests are straight forward, and basically reflect exactly what he teaches in class. If you can, get into his class without further thinking!

Dr. Ferreira is an enthusiastic, funny, friendly teacher, and if I wasn't about to graduate I would go out of my way to take him again. He has a mastery of environmental science, and his class was both fascinating and fun. I learned so much, and it wasn't hard at all! Amazing class
Everyone loves Dr. F, he is young and excited to teach. He will go above and beyond. As long as your not sleeping and you show up, you should be ok.

This was a very enjoyable class.  He breaks down the material so everyone can understand it, even with no prior Chemistry experience.  If you understand all the Sapling homework, you will be fine, because the tests are much easier.

Great professor, explains the material very well and his notes are easy to follow. Posts all powerpoints online and has a powerpoint review with everything that is on the test. His homework helps you to learn the material, explains what to do if you get the problem wrong and why. Over all, great professor. dressed up like Thor for Halloween.

Dr. F is a great teacher over all. I'm a freshmen and took honors chem in high school and i got a A by simply going to his class and studying the week before the exam. He uses sapling hw so i literally used yahoo to do it all and it worked. easy quizzes. tests are pretty manageable as long as you do you part. He gives a study guide for every test.

DR. F is great. He obviously loves environmental science and will make you love it too. Make sure you know the power point material in his environmental classes because he give essay questions and you need to know what the hell your talk about. He can be strict on the essay questions. He really loves this subject and very involved.

Excellent Professor.  Had him Fall 2012 for both lecture and lab.  He explains everything well and lets you know what you should have learned each day.  Go to class because he uses easy quizzes to take attendance.  His tests were not too bad, and the homework is online.  I received a B only because I was lazy toward the end of the semester.

I like the class. It was freshly offered this semester(spring 2013). He is a good professor. Lab was kind of interesting. I enjoyed our two field trips. He keeps the class interesting, where it could get dry.
Good young professor.

Great professor! Lectures are entertaining and he explains the material very well. He takes attendance with extremely easy quizzes that worth like five percent of your final grade. Go to class, recitation and do all the online homework and you will get lots of points.

Really good professor. He begins each class with an overview of the objectives for that day, and ends each class by summarizing the lecture. He keeps track of attendance with easy quizzes that are a free A. His tests are not difficult and are straightfoward - if you study and prepare, you'll definitely get an A or B on them.
